In an attempt to get this thread back on topic, I would like to re-ask a
question that was asked before (by Vladimir and didn't seem to get an
answer:

What about JUnitX?

While I explained why I come down on the side of testing behavior vs.
methods explicitly, and why I think it is quite possible to test most
private methods in that manner, I will concede that there are code or
behavior paths that you may not be able to invoke in any other manner - for
example, when it comes to exceptions or errors that are just unlikely to
happen in normal circumstances, but for which you must create code to
handle. It might be necessary to write explicit tests of private methods in
such a way as to invoke this code.

So, if you are like me, and advocate a parallel and separate test
architecture (ala McGregor et. al.) for test classes, how has JUnitX worked
for you?

Thanks,
Lauren
